eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.Canvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Canvas
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A canvas which supports easy drawing of elementary geometric objects. As it extends JPanel, it should be used within a frame, for instance in the CanvasWindow.
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Canvas

        public Canvas(int width,
              int height)
        Creates a new Canvas with the given width and weight.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the canvas
        height - The height of the canvas

    • Method Detail

      • isEuclidean

        public boolean isEuclidean()
        Returns:
        true if the canvas is Euclidean, i.e. it has origin in the middle and y axis increases in the upper direction. Returns false otherwise, i.e. when origin is in the left top corner and y axis increases in the lower direction.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Clears the canvas: deletes permanently all objects, labels and the grid and repaints the canvas.

      • clearAllButGrid

        public void clearAllButGrid()
        Clears the canvas, but leaves the grid in place: deletes permanently all objects, labels and repaints the canvas.

      • drawGrid

        public void drawGrid(double columnSize,
                     double rowSize)
        Draws the default grid. The line thickness is set to 0.1, the color is set to gray. If called multiple times, the original grid is replaced with the newer one.
        Parameters:
        columnSize - The horizontal distance between grid lines
        rowSize - The vertical distance between grid lines

      • drawGrid

        public void drawGrid(float thickness,
                     double columnSize,
                     double rowSize,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Draws grid with the given properties. If called multiple times, the original grid is replaced with the newer one.
        Parameters:
        thickness - The thickness of the grid lines
        columnSize - The horizontal distance between grid lines
        rowSize - The vertical distance between grid lines
        color - The color of the grid

      • setEuclideanCoordinates

        public void setEuclideanCoordinates(boolean value)
        By default, the canvas uses the standard Java graphics coordinate system, i.e. the origin (0,0) is in the left top corner and y axis coordinates increase downwards. This method changes it so that Euclidean-like coordinates are used, i.e. the origin (0,0) is in the middle of the canvas and y increases upwards.
        Parameters:
        value - If true, Euclidean-like coordinate system is used. If false, the standard Java graphics coordinate system is used.

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double zoomFactor)
        Zooms in/out the canvas and repaints the canvas. The zoom factor determines by how much the canvas shall be zoomed. The zoom has no effect on the grid.
        Parameters:
        zoomFactor - Determines the zooming factor. Numbers between 0 and 1 zoom out, numbers greater than 1 zoom in. Negative numbers behave equivalently, but flip the image around the origin first.

      • getZoom

        public double getZoom()
        Returns:
        Returns the current zoom factor of the canvas.

      • translate

        public void translate(double dx,
                      double dy)
        Translates the view by the given translation vector (i.e. the original translation vector is increased by the given translation vector) and repaints the canvas. The grid is translated as well.
        Parameters:
        dx - The translation change in x direction
        dy - The translation change in y direction

      • setTranslation

        public void setTranslation(double tx,
                           double ty)
        Sets the translation of the view to the given translation vector and repaints the canvas. The grid is translated as well.
        Parameters:
        tx - The translation in x direction
        ty - The translation in y direction

      • getTranslation

        public MCoordinate getTranslation()
        Returns:
        The current translation vector.

      • resetTranslationAndZoom

        public void resetTranslationAndZoom()
        Resets the translation vector to (0,0), sets the zoom factor to 1 and repaints.

      • resetTranslation

        public void resetTranslation()
        Resets the translation vector to (0,0) and repaints.

      • resetZoom

        public void resetZoom()
        Resets the zoom factor to 1 and repaints.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns:
        The screenshot of the current canvas
